column1: Bahía Honda is a municipality and town in the Artemisa Province of Cuba. Before 2011 belonged to Pinar del Río Province.
It is located on the northern shore of the island
column2: in an inlet of the Florida Straits
column3: 70 km (43 mi) west of Havana. The sheltered bay that gives the name to the municipality contains an industrial port. It marks the eastern extend of the Colorados Archipelago.

column1: Bahía Honda was once one of the naval bases leased to the United States under the Platt Amendment
column2: but abandoned in 1912 in turn for an expansion of the area leased around Guantánamo Bay.
the municipality of Bahía Honda had a population of 45
column3: 968. With a total area of 784 km2 (303 sq mi)
column4: it has a population density of 58.6/km2 (152/sq mi).

column1: This area  typically has a pronounced dry season
column2: but average monthly precipitation does not get lower than 68 mm (in March) in Bahía Honda
column3: making this a more humid locality than many others in the region.  According to the Köppen Climate Classification system
column5: Cuba has a tropical rainforest climate
